Almost all IS members are certified, but practices deviate from the formality of ITIL.   Knowledge of ITIL is necessary, but conformance is not.
GreenStone has demonstrated a disinclination to be shackled by the constraints of Scrum.
A large portion of traditional SOA is wasteful.   Reusability is the most valuable SOA principle.

Chapter 5 of the SRE describes toil as "the kind of work that tends to be manual, repetitive, auomatable, tactical, devoid of enduring value and that scales linearly as service grows."  While this is inconsistent with some devops principles, multiple flight teams leverage toil as a technique used to deliver value to our customers.   Jason believes this should be Adopt to reflect how it is valued currently within the enterprise;  the rest of the team believes this should be Hold.
deploy to env upon commit
build packages upon commit

Shift Left is a practice intended to find and prevent defects early in the software delivery process. The idea is to improve quality by moving tasks to the left as early in the lifecycle as possible. Shift Left testing means testing earlier in the software development process.
Inferior to almost all other ways of deploying cloud infrastructure.
Javascript Build Manager.  Used by Grey Duck.   Might be supersceded by NPM or WebPack.  It's in some projects, but shouldn't be used for new ones
